question_text: What is the role of the Independent Verification & Validation (IV&V) agent in the testing of the Aegis-Link software?
ground_truth_answer: The IV&V agent, an external contractor, is responsible for independently developing and executing a subset of tests on the final software build to verify critical requirements and provide an objective report on their findings.

retrieval_path.source_quote: The IV&V agent will be provided with the SRS and the final software build. They will independently develop and execute a subset of tests to verify critical functionality and performance requirements.

question_text: What hardware is required to conduct system testing for the Aegis-Link software?
ground_truth_answer: The required hardware for Aegis-Link system testing includes a dedicated test server, a hardware-in-the-loop simulator for the Hydra-C4 and Trident-S systems, and at least one production-representative unit of both the Hydra-C4 and Trident-S for final integration testing.

retrieval_path.source_quote: A dedicated test server running the Aegis-Link software.
A hardware-in-the-loop simulator capable of simulating the interfaces and data streams of the Hydra-C4 and Trident-S systems.
At least one production-representative Hydra-C4 and Trident-S unit for final integration testing.

question_text: According to the Aegis-Link Test Plan, what is the governing document that defines the process for managing defects found during testing?
ground_truth_answer: The Aegis-Link Test Plan states that the defect management lifecycle (logging, triage, resolution, etc.) must follow the process defined in the Test & Evaluation Master Plan (SS-TEST-PLAN-001), Section 7.

retrieval_path.source_quote: The lifecycle for defect management (logging, triage, resolution, verification, closure) shall follow the process defined in SS-TEST-PLAN-001, Section 7.

7.1 Defect Management Lifecycle
1. Identification: A potential defect is observed during testing.
2. Logging: A formal Defect Report (DR) is created...

question_text: Test case TC-SEC-02 in the Aegis-Link test plan is designed to verify which specific software requirement from the SRS?
ground_truth_answer: Test case TC-SEC-02 verifies requirement REQ-NFR-008 from the Aegis-Link SRS (SS-AEG-SRS-001), which states that the software shall automatically log out a user after 30 minutes of inactivity.

retrieval_path.source_quote: REQ-NFR-008: The software shall automatically log out a user after 30 minutes of inactivity.

question_text: The Aegis-Link Test plan mentions multiple levels of testing. Which parent document defines the overall corporate strategy for these levels of testing, such as System Integration Testing and Factory Acceptance Testing?
ground_truth_answer: The overall corporate strategy and definitions for the different levels of testing (Component, Integration, System) are established in the Test & Evaluation Master Plan (SS-TEST-PLAN-001).

retrieval_path.source_quote: The overall test strategy, including defect management and reporting, is governed by the master framework established in SS-TEST-PLAN-001: Test & Evaluation Master Plan (TEMP).

5. Levels of Testing
Our T&E strategy employs a progressive, multi-level approach to build confidence in the system from the component level up to the final integrated product.

question_text: What is the name of the external third-party contractor selected to be the IV&V agent for the Aegis-Link software?
ground_truth_answer: I am sorry, but the provided documents do not name the specific contractor selected for the Independent Verification & Validation (IV&V) role. The plan only states that an external, third-party contractor will be used.
